summary: sir bradley wiggins will bid for cycling 's hour record on june 7 at london 's olympic velodrome . the four-time olympic champion and 2012 tour de france winner will attempt to add to his accomplishments by riding the furthest distance in 60 minutes at the lee valley velopark . wiggins finished his team sky career in the paris-roubaix 253.5km one-day race on sunday .

aspect: 1. Sir Bradley Wiggins will attempt the hour record on June 7 at London's Olympic Velodrome.
2. Wiggins is a four-time Olympic champion and former Tour de France winner.
3. He is targeting the hour record to motivate others and challenge himself.
4. Wiggins hopes to break the record set by Rohan Dennis.
5. Tickets to watch the event will go on sale on April 19.
explain:
Sir Bradley Wiggins will attempt the hour record on June 7 at London's Olympic Velodrome.

In summary, Sir Bradley Wiggins, a four-time Olympic champion and former Tour de France winner, plans to break the Hour Record, which involves riding the furthest distance within 60 minutes on a velodrome. This challenging cycling feat will take place at London's Olympic Velodrome on June 7. Wiggins' attempt follows his recent participation in the Paris-Roubaix, a demanding one-day race that he completed on Sunday.

Wiggins is a four-time Olympic champion and a former Tour de France winner.

Explanation: 
Sir Bradley Wiggins is a British cyclist who has achieved great success in the world of cycling. He has won four gold medals at the Olympic Games, each in a different cycling discipline. These victories include the individual and team pursuit, as well as the road race. Wiggins is known for his exceptional endurance and tactical prowess, which have served him well throughout his career. In addition to his Olympic success, Wiggins has also won the prestigious Tour de France, making him one of a select few cyclists to have achieved this feat. This accomplishment further solidified his status as a legend in the world of cycling.

Sir Bradley Wiggins' primary motive for targeting the hour record on June 7 is to motivate others and challenge himself.

The main idea behind Aspect 3 is that Sir Bradley Wiggins wants to inspire others and push his personal limits by attempting the hour record. By pursuing this feat, he aims to encourage other athletes, especially cycling enthusiasts, to set ambitious goals and work hard to achieve them. This effort is also significant for Wiggins as a way to challenge himself after concluding his successful career with Team Sky in the Paris-Roubaix race on Sunday. The hour record attempt represents a formidable challenge that requires months of preparation, determination, and perseverance, which aligns well with his drive to motivate others.

It suggests that Sir Bradley Wiggins intends to break the current hour record set by Rohan Dennis, which currently stands at 52.452 kilometers (32.631 miles). Wiggins will attempt to surpass this distance by riding the furthest possible distance in 60 minutes during his June 7 attempt at London's Olympic Velodrome.
